creator: apache-2011@ryandesign.com
text:
The just-released Subversion 1.7 supports case-only renames on case-insensitive filesystems, but only on Windows:

http://subversion.apache.org/docs/release-notes/1.7.html#windows-case-change

http://svn.haxx.se/users/archive-2011-10/0616.shtml

I'm told this is achieved using APR's "truepath-conversion" / "truename" rename capability, which apparently is not implemented yet for Mac OS X. This ticket is a request to add that capability on Mac OS X as well, since Macs have always used case-insensitive filesystems by default.

APR should, already, rename most files to the given case.

You might have to reclass this as an SVN issue to draw it proper attention.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
apache-2011@ryandesign.com
text:
Are you sure? A Subversion developer said it's an APR problem and asked me to file it as an APR bug.

http://svn.haxx.se/users/archive-2011-10/0621.shtml

To be more precise subversion uses apr_filepath_merge() with the APR_FILEPATH_TRUENAME flag when it needs the true name of a path.

On Windows this returns the path as it is on disk, while it doesn't perform any path translations on other operating systems.
